com.samsung.sami.manifest

Class ManifestUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.sami.manifest.ManifestUtil

  • public final class ManifestUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods Parses a manifest as a String and returns a manifest instance.

    Currently only the Groovy language is supported.

    See Also:
    Manifest

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ManifestUtil.ManifestInterfaceException
      This exceptions is caused by a manifest not implementing Manifest interface.
      static class  ManifestUtil.ManifestParseException
      This exception is caused by a manifest not being parseable by the platform.

    • Method Detail

      • parseManifest

        public static SamiManifest parseManifest(String manifest)
        Takes a manifest as a raw String and returns a Java representation as a SamiManifest object. This method is interpreting the groovy string, and SHOULD NOT be run with untrusted input.
        Parameters:
        manifest - the String to be parsed.
        Returns:
        a representation of the manifest as a SamiManifest object.

      • checkUntrustedManifest

        public static void checkUntrustedManifest(String manifest)
        Takes a manifest as a raw String and check that the manifest is well parsed. It will only check that it's a well formatted groovy string : an exception is raised if the input is invalid. This function can be called before the manual manifest validation process to check the user Groovy input.
        Parameters:
        manifest -

      • isValidLanguage

        public static boolean isValidLanguage(String language)
        Checks whether a language is a valid manifest language.
        Parameters:
        language - the language to be checked.
        Returns:
        a boolean value that is true if the language is supported, and false otherwise.

      • toMap

        public static Map<String,Field> toMap(List<Field> listOfFields)
        Builds a map of field name: field from a list of fields.
        Parameters:
        listOfFields - a list of fields.
        Returns:
        a map of field name: field.
